entries.title: The Justice Department released what it says is its final trove of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein. Here are some takeaways on what we know so far.
At a congressional hearing, Attorney General Pam Bondi declined to apologize directly to a group of Jeffrey Epstein’s victims who were seated behind her
The Pentagon has told a second aircraft carrier strike group to prepare to deploy to the Middle East as the U.S. military prepares for a potential attack on Iran, according to three U.S. officials
Casey Wasserman will remain chairman of the committee organizing the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, its executive committee said Wednesday
A grand jury declined to indict multiple Democratic lawmakers, including Sen. Mark Kelly, who in a video told military servicemembers they could refuse to obey illegal orders, sources said
The U.S. budget deficit will widen over the next decade as interest costs consume an increasing share of spending, the CBO said in a forecast that highlighted the country’s long-run fiscal challenges

House lawmakers rejected an attempt by Speaker Mike Johnson to block votes on resolutions disapproving of President Trump’s tariffs—paving the way for lawmakers to rebuke Trump’s signature economic policy
Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick became the first Trump administration cabinet official to publicly admit visiting Jeffrey Epstein’s island. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:
Newly released Justice Department documents appear to show an effort to get Donald Trump to contribute to Jeffrey Epstein’s 50th birthday book
Here are the takeaways from the House testimony of Immigration and Customs Enforcement Acting Director Todd Lyons and Customs and Border Protection Commissioner Rodney Scott
Vice President JD Vance posted on X acknowledging the Armenian genocide, and then deleted the post, upsetting Armenian diaspora communities in the U.S.
Unsealed document shows role Kurt Olsen, hired by the White House to investigation election fraud claims, played in spurring search of Georgia office.
President Trump’s effort to push Republican state lawmakers to create more GOP-favorable House districts is on track to yield far fewer gains than expected
President Trump made gains in 2024 with Latinos, a demographic that historically has voted for Democrats, but the economy and deportations are a headwind in the midterms
Five reasons Republicans are worried about this Texas state Senate race
A state-level Democratic win in a region that had voted decisively for President Trump threatens to diminish Republicans’ hopes for the midterm elections
The Pentagon has warned defense contractors to brace for sweeping performance reviews that will identify companies it says aren’t fulfilling their contracts
Whistleblower complaint against Tulsi Gabbard is based on U.S.-intercepted phone conversation in which individuals linked to a foreign government discussed a person close to President Trump
The Trump administration announced a new strategy for overseas arms sales that is centered on boosting the manufacture of weapons most important to the U.S. military
President Trump announced that he wants the U.S. to negotiate a new strategic arms treaty following the lapse of the last major nuclear pact with Russia
The top Democrat on a House committee overseeing U.S.-China competition has launched a probe into a $500 million investment by an Abu Dhabi royal in a Trump family cryptocurrency company
